msDesc.head: Eusebius of Caesarea, Historia ecclesiastica, in the Latin translation of Rufinus

msItem.rubric: Fol. 1r. Incipit prologus Rufini presbiteri in libro ecclesiastice historie.
Fol. 2r. Incipit prefacio eusebii cesariensis episcopi. in ecclesiastica historia.
msItem.finalRubric: Fol. 3r. Explicit prefatio. Incipit liber primus
msItem.incipit: Igitur quoniam christus duplici ex modo constat
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber non us. Incipit prologus Rufini in librum decimum.
msItem.rubric: Fol. 160v. Incipit liber decimus. De arru heresi.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 195r. cum piissimis principibus percepturus premia meritorum.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber undecimus ecclesiastice. hystorie. Ha bet annos cccc in summa.
msItem.author: Eusebius
msItem.title: Historia ecclesiastica, in the Latin translation of Rufinus

listBibl.bibl: The Eusebius text ed. Th. Mommsen, Eusebius Werke (Die griechischen Schriftsteller der ersten drei Jahrhunderte. Eusebius II.I, 2) (Leipzig, 1903, 1908).
The prologue and two final books, by Rufinus, pr. PL 21. 461-540.

supportDesc.support:
Written on 195 membrane leaves, some with blemishes repaired before writing, preceded by a paper flyleaf (s. xviii) and a medieval membrane flyleaf and followed by a paper flyleaf (s. xviii).
Fore- and endleaves: fol. ir, number; fol. iv, blank; fol. iir, blank; fol. iiv, ex libris; fol. Irv, blank.
supportDesc.collation: 1-248 25 three. Quire numbers up to xxi, with gaps. One fragmentary catchword remains, on fol. 96v.

layoutDesc.layout:
Written in two columns, each
200-5 60
31 lines. Pricked in outer and inner margins, ruled in crayon, and folded HSOS.

handDesc.handNote: A good protogothic bookhand. Fols. 193-5, a separate quire, are in a bookhand of s. xiiiin which is virtually gothic in character although the only fused letters are de and pp. Like the rest of the text these leaves are written above top line. Punctuation is by point and punctus elevatus, but that of fols. 193-5 is by low and high point, punctus elevatus, and punctus interrogativus.

decoDesc.decoNote: Good two/five-line capitals in red-and-green, some plain and some with marginal extensions, some ornamented with a white pattern. Running numbers of books are red and in lists of capitula small capitals and figures are in alternate red and green.

binding.p: Sewn on five bands between heavy, projecting, square-edged wooden boards covered with white alum-tawed skin (s. xviii). At the front is a flyleaf (fol. ii), a former pastedown, apparently from the back of the volume since it has five (formerly six) holes from the chain-plate at the bottom (position 1), and at top left, in the margin, is a cutout for the clasp at the top, which shows that leaf is back-to-front. The last leaf of the text (fol. 195) has been next to this flyleaf; at the bottom it shows six stains from nails of the chain-plate. At the bottom of fols. 192v and 193rv are small rust marks. On the spine is a black leather lozenge-shaped label with 9 on it and a black leather label with a title. Edges are yellowed and there is a fore-edge title.

history.provenance:
At the bottom of fol. 1r it is ex libris style 1, Liber Collegij animarum omnium fidelium Oxonie ex dono Regis Henrici vjti. Oretis pro Inclito statu eiusdem. (textura, s. xv). Ker, All Souls, List 1, no. 20, with other books in Henry yes gift. At the top of the page is ex libris style 2, Liber Collegii Omnium Animarum Fidelium Defunctorum de Oxon. (also on fol. iiv in textura perhaps of s. xv, reading ...in Oxon...). No. 1408 (7) in CMA.
All Souls library identifications, on which see Introduction, are, on the pastedown, vv.9.12 and ww:5:9 (both deleted), M.S. 46 (figure added), 138 (pencil), L.R. 2.c.10 (pencil), and bookplate no. 10, and on fol. ir 7.2 (pencil); on fol. 1r are K.s.d and P.<..>. There are marginalia in a secretary hand of c.1600 and occasionally (e.g. fols. 149r, 150r) in a humanist hand of the same date: all may, indeed, be by the same writer.

recordHist.source: Andrew G. Watson, A Descriptive Catalogue of the Medieval Manuscripts of All Souls College Oxford (Oxford, 1997)

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact library@all-souls.ox.ac.uk.
